question: After the removal of introns in the nucleus, a mature mRNA transcript contains 500 nucleotides. This mRNA is then used to produce a polypeptide of 110 amino acids. Which of the following statements best describes the portion of this mRNA that actually codes for the protein?
answers: 110 nucleotides of the mRNA are translated into amino acids of the protein.
170 nucleotides of the mRNA are translated into amino acids of the protein.
330 nucleotides of the mRNA are translated into amino acids of the protein.
500 nucleotides of the mRNA are translated into amino acids of the protein.
